label: Description

Below, a ribbon is inscribed in gold paint: "Ursprung S[ancta] M[aria] Ceel[am See]". Green framing line on mount. Souvenir of The Shrine of Cell-am-See, on Lake Constance.

label: Provenance
value: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Plate showing Christie's Auction Room from the series 'Microcosm of London.' A crowd stands in a high-ceilinged room, with light streaming in through high windows. Paintings in ornate frames are hung salon-style, with vaguely recognizable classical compositions: an Annunciation, an Adoration, a saint, an equestrian scene, a portrait. A reclining Venus is displayed on the auction stand, and before her a lively and colorful crowd is shown, with detailed dress and caricatured features.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and wash, etching and aquatint on paper

label: Description
value: The Magdalene is seen seated by a mound of earth on which rests a skull; two seraph above. Below, a bunch of flowers and a blank inscriptional ribbon. Green framing line on mount.
